definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to give the eye to/to make eyes at

sentences.english: I praise the Lord for his unfairness of bestowing such pair of eyes and the lips.
sentences.chinese: 我讚美上帝的不公，他賜予你這樣的眉眼和嘴脣。

sentences.english: The expression of eyes is one of the most important parts in body language.
sentences.chinese: 眉眼語是人體語言的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: No matter how tough, life should be smiling.
sentences.chinese: 不管有多難熬，人生都要眉眼帶笑。

sentences.english: But that eyebrow eye easily pick of yet is secretly a Wan chaste regal concubine's one eye.
sentences.chinese: 而那眉眼輕挑的卻是暗暗剜了德妃一眼。

sentences.english: Lips, eyes, eyebrows and the new lines in her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 雙脣，眉眼，額頭新生的皺紋。

definition: the flat area of forehead between the eyebrows/glabella
outer tip of the eyebrow/(facial) expression/(Tw) knack/trick of the trade
five sense organs of TCM (nose, eyes, lips, tongue, ears 鼻目口舌耳)/facial features
red phoenix eyes (eyes whose outer corners incline upwards)
general facial appearance/features/arrangement/sequence of ideas/logic (of writing)/rough sketch or general idea of things
progress/prospect of solution/sign of positive outcome
to have bright eyes and white teeth
